etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in John Norden (c1547–1625), cartographer. From post-classical Latin recogitation-, recogitatio action of thinking over something again (early 3rd century in Tertullian) from classical Latin recōgitāt-, past participial stem of recōgitāre + -iō

definitions: The action or result of thinking over something again; an instance of this.
